charge_type.source: The defendant pleaded not guilty before a magistrate ... to one count of trafficking in dangerous drugs, contrary to section 4(1)(a) and (3) of the Dangerous Drugs Ordinance, Cap 134

drugs.source: 4 re-sealable plastic bags containing totally 17.0 grammes of “Ice”; particulars: 17.3g of a crystalline solid containing 17.0g of methamphetamine hydrochloride
3 plastic bags containing 14.4 grammes of herbal cannabis

role.source: the judge, identifying the applicant’s role as a “storekeeper”; and, by arithmetically applying the applicable guidelines, adopted a starting point of 7½ years’ imprisonment

aggravating_factors.source: trafficking in more than one type of drug was an aggravating factor, the judge enhanced the starting point by 1 month
the judge further found the applicant to be a persistent offender, for which he enhanced the sentence by a further 6 months

guilty_plea.source: The defendant did plead guilty on 22 January 2025, admitted to the summary of facts ... he indicated he would plead guilty about 1 month after the trial dates were fixed

starting_point.source: adopt a starting point of 7 years and 6 months, being the arithmetical application of the tariff

sentence_after_role.source: based on my finding of the defendant’s role and culpability, I adopt a starting point of 7 years and 6 months

notional_sentence.source: enhanced by 6 months for persistent offender and 1 month for multiple drugs, taking the total to 8 years and 1 month

final_sentence.source: the applicant was given a discount of about 25% ... resulting in a sentence of 6 years and 1 month’s imprisonment
